intro: Euryspermum microcephalum, commonly known as the small-headed euryspermum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb with slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky habitats.
